member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordDataAttribute
member.summary: Defines an attribute to mark a property on a record class as 'data'.
member.remarks: Marking a property as 'data' means that the property is not a key and not a vector. But optionally, this property can have an associated vector field containing an embedding for this data. The characteristics defined here influence how the property is treated by the vector store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordDataAttribute.IsFilterable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this data property is filterable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordDataAttribute.IsFullTextSearchable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this data property is full-text searchable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordDataAttribute.StoragePropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordKeyAttribute
member.summary: Defines an attribute to mark a property on a record class as the key under which the record is stored in a vector store.
member.remarks: The characteristics defined here influence how the property is treated by the vector store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordKeyAttribute.StoragePropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordVectorAttribute
member.summary: Defines an attribute to mark a property on a record class as a vector.
member.remarks: The characteristics defined here influence how the property is treated by the vector store.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The distance function to use when comparing vectors.
The kind of index to use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordVectorAttribute.Dimensions
member.summary: Gets the number of dimensions that the vector has.
member.remarks: This property is required when creating collections, but can be omitted if not using that functionality. If not provided when trying to create a collection, create will fail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordVectorAttribute.IndexKind
member.summary: Gets the kind of index to use.
member.value: The default value varies by database type. See the documentation of your chosen database connector for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordVectorAttribute.DistanceFunction
member.summary: Gets the distance function to use when comparing vectors.
member.value: The default value varies by database type. See the documentation of your chosen database connector for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordVectorAttribute.StoragePropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name to use for the property in storage, if different from the property name.
member.remarks: For example, the property name might be "MyProperty" and the storage name might be "my_property".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction
member.summary: Defines a list of well-known distance functions that can be used to compare vectors.
member.remarks: Not all Vector Store connectors support all distance functions, and some connectors might support additional distance functions that aren't defined here. See the documentation for each connector for more information on what is supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.CosineSimilarity
member.summary: The cosine (angular) similarity between two vectors.
member.remarks: Measures only the angle between the two vectors, without taking into account the length of the vectors. ConsineSimilarity = 1 - CosineDistance. -1 means vectors are opposite. 0 means vectors are orthogonal. 1 means vectors are identical.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.CosineDistance
member.summary: The cosine (angular) similarity between two vectors.
member.remarks: CosineDistance = 1 - CosineSimilarity. 2 means vectors are opposite. 1 means vectors are orthogonal. 0 means vectors are identical.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.DotProductSimilarity
member.summary: Measures both the length and angle between two vectors.
member.remarks: The higher the value, the more similar the vectors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.NegativeDotProductSimilarity
member.summary: Measures both the length and angle between two vectors.
member.remarks: The value of NegativeDotProduct = -1 * DotProductSimilarity. The higher the value, the greater the distance between the vectors and the less similar the vectors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.EuclideanDistance
member.summary: Measures the Euclidean distance between two vectors.
member.remarks: Also known as l2-norm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.EuclideanSquaredDistance
member.summary: Measures the Euclidean squared distance between two vectors.
member.remarks: Also known as l2-squared.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.Hamming
member.summary: The number of differences between vectors at each dimensions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.DistanceFunction.ManhattanDistance
member.summary: Measures the Manhattan distance between two vectors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind
member.summary: Defines a list of well-known index types that can be used to index vectors.
member.remarks: Not all Vector Store connectors support all index types, and some connectors might support additional index types that aren't defined here. See the documentation for each connector for more information on what is supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.Hnsw
member.summary: Hierarchical Navigable Small World, which performs an approximate nearest neighbour (ANN) search.
member.remarks: This search has lower accuracy than exhaustive k nearest neighbor, but is faster and more efficient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.Flat
member.summary: Brute force search to find the nearest neighbors.
member.remarks: This search calculates the distances between all pairs of data points, so it has a linear time complexity that grows directly proportional to the number of points. It's also referred to as exhaustive k nearest neighbor in some databases. This search has high recall accuracy, but is slower and more expensive than HNSW. It works better with smaller datasets.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.IvfFlat
member.summary: Inverted File with Flat Compression.
member.remarks: This search is designed to enhance search efficiency by narrowing the search area through the use of neighbor partitions or clusters. Also referred to as approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.DiskAnn
member.summary: Disk-based Approximate Nearest Neighbor algorithm designed for efficiently searching for approximate nearest neighbors (ANN) in high-dimensional spaces.
member.remarks: The primary focus of DiskANN is to handle large-scale datasets that can't fit entirely into memory, leveraging disk storage to store the data while maintaining fast search times.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.QuantizedFlat
member.summary: Index that compresses vectors using DiskANN-based quantization methods for better efficiency in the kNN search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IndexKind.Dynamic
member.summary: Dynamic index allows to automatically switch from to indexes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1
member.summary: Options for hybrid search when using a dense vector and string keywords to do the search.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.OldFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a search filter to use before doing the hybrid search.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets a search filter to use before doing the vector search.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.VectorProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the target dense vector property to search on. Only needs to be set when the collection has multiple vector properties.
member.value: If not provided will check if there is a vector property to use by default, and will throw if either none or multiple exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.AdditionalProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional target property to do the text/keyword search on. The property must have full text search enabled. If not provided will look if there is a text property with full text search enabled, and will throw if either none or multiple exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of results to return.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.Skip
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of results to skip before returning results, i.e. the index of the first result to return.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.IncludeVectors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include vectors in the retrieval result.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.HybridSearchOptions`1.IncludeTotalCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the total count should be included in the results.
member.remarks: Default value is false. Not all vector search implementations will support this option in which case the total count will be null even if requested via this option.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IKeywordHybridSearch`1

member.summary: Performs a hybrid search for records that match the given embedding and keywords, after applying the provided filters.

The options that control the behavior of the search.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the vector property to search on. Use the name of the vector property from your data model or as provided in the record definition.

member.summary: Gets or sets the vector property to search on. Only needs to be set when the collection has multiple vector properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorSearchOptions`1.Skip
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of results to skip before returning results, that is, the index of the first result to return.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStore
member.summary: Defines an interface for accessing the list of collections in a vector store.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStore.GetCollection``2(System.String,Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.VectorStoreRecordDefinition)
member.summary: Gets a collection from the vector store.

The record data model to use for adding, updating, and retrieving data from the collection.
member.param: The name of the collection.
The schema of the record type.
member.returns: A new instance for managing the records in the collection.
member.remarks: To successfully request a collection, either must be annotated with attributes that define the schema of the record type, or must be provided.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStoreRecordCollection`2.GetAsync(`0,Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.GetRecordOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a record from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists. Returns null if the record is not found.
member.param: The unique ID associated with the record to get.
Optional options for retrieving the record.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The record if found, otherwise null.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.
The mapping between the storage model and record data model fails.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStoreRecordCollection`2.GetBatchAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.GetRecordOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a batch of records from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The unique IDs associated with the record to get.
Optional options for retrieving the records.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The records associated with the specified unique keys.
member.remarks: Gets are made in a single request or in a single parallel batch depending on the available store functionality. Only found records are returned, so the result set might be smaller than the requested keys. This method throws for any issues other than records not being found.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.
The mapping between the storage model and record data model fails.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStoreRecordCollection`2.DeleteAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes a record from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The unique ID associated with the record to remove.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The unique identifier for the record.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason other than that the record does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStoreRecordCollection`2.DeleteBatchAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes a batch of records from the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists.
member.param: The unique IDs associated with the records to remove.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A that completes when the records have been deleted.
member.remarks: Deletes are made in a single request or in a single parallel batch, depending on the available store functionality. If a record isn't found, it is ignored and the batch succeeds. If any record can't be deleted for any other reason, the operation throws. Some records might have already been deleted while others might not have, so the entire operation should be retried.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason other than that a record does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.VectorData.IVectorStoreRecordCollection`2.UpsertAsync(`1,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Upserts a record into the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists. If the record already exists, it is updated. If the record does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The record to upsert.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The unique identifier for the record.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.
The mapping between the storage model and record data model fails.

member.summary: Upserts a group of records into the vector store. Does not guarantee that the collection exists. If the record already exists, it is updated. If the record does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The records to upsert.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: The unique identifiers for the records.
member.remarks: Upserts are made in a single request or in a single parallel batch depending on the available store functionality.
member.exception: The command fails to execute for any reason.
The mapping between the storage model and record data model fails.
